product_description: Palermo is a beautiful, luxe, printable velvet base cloth in a cream tone with an irregular pile.
recyclable_percentage_description: Yes, we have a recycling program through our internal Waste Warriors team. Everything is separated to be upcycled / reused through local charities or recycled through TRG (Textile Recyclers Group).
recyclable_offcuts_description: This product can be recycled through various programs in Australia, such as TRAKS, as long as it is uncontaminated i.e. no staples, hooks or adhesives.
recycling_process_description: We recycle unusable offcuts with onshore Textile Recyclers Group where it is made back into recycled yarn
water_reduction_techniques: Our digital print facilities uses little to no water.
minimisation_design_strategy: We print on demand so there is very little wastage. What can be reused is picked up by our local charity partners. And we have a recycling program with Coritex for any unusable waste which is shredded to make mattresses at Sealy's shoddy factory.
factory_finished_description: Printing of designs onto the textile substrate involves dye sublimation, the initial stage of which is printing the design onto FSC certified paper, using OEKO-TEX ECO PASSPORT certified inks.

material_locations.material: Post-consumer recycled polyester. Detail is where the mill is located.
Polyester. Detail is where the mill is located.

other_comments:
https://materialised.com.au/sustainability/
https://materialised.com.au/sustainable-fabric-and-walls/
https://materialised.com.au/sustainability/recycling-charities/
type_of_packaging: We are APCO members and achieved a Beyond Best Practice overall performance level for the reporting period January – December 2022. This means we have received the highest performance level and made significant progress on our packaging sustainability journey. You can read more about using recycling and upcycling packaging on our website https://materialised.com.au/sustainability/recycling-charities/

product_description: Eden TPO is a sustainable, printable, high-performance wall covering perfect for commercial use.
recyclable_percentage_description: This product can be safely incinerated, turning to water vapour
water_reduction_techniques: The dye sublimation and digital print process uses little to no water. We do have rain water tanks for our toilets.
minimisation_design_strategy: We print to order by the lineal metre and so there is very little waste. Our wall murals printed onto Eden are designed specifically to fit the space/
factory_finished_description: Printing of designs onto the wall covering substrate using a highly energy-efficient, direct to substrate digital printer with Greenguard Gold certified inks.

material_locations.material: TPO face with cellulose backing. These are details for the mill

other_comments:
KEY FEATURES:

PVC free.
No vinyl resins.
Chlorine free.
No heavy metals.
Formaldehyde free.
Halogen free.
Low VOC’s.
Can be safely incinerated, turning to water vapour.

Company sustainability processes and practices: https://materialised.com.au/sustainability/
Company waste warriors team: https://materialised.com.au/sustainability/recycling-charities/
type_of_packaging: We are APCO members and achieved a Beyond Best Practice overall performance level for the reporting period January – December 2022. This means we have received the highest performance level and made significant progress on our packaging sustainability journey.

product_description: Made with 100% post-consumer recycled polyester, Midnight is a printable acoustic curtain fabric.
recyclable_percentage_description: This product can be recycled through various programs in Australia, such as TRAKS, as long as it is uncontaminated i.e. no staples, hooks or adhesives.
recyclable_offcuts_description: Yes, we have a recycling program through our internal Waste Warriors team. Everything is separated to be upcycled / reused through local charities or recycled through TRG (Textile Recyclers Group).
recycled_content_description: 100% recycled. See Global Recycled Standard certificate
recycling_process_description: Polyester can be recycled / repurposed through a waste program such as our onshore partnership with Coritex and Sealy
minimisation_design_strategy: We print to order so there is very little wastage and whatever offcuts we have here are repurposed.
type_of_packaging: 100% recycled cardboard core and a clear plastic wrap that can be recycled

product_description: A high-performance, sustainable, flame retardant wall covering with the high-end look of felt.
recyclable_percentage_description: Yes it can be recycled through TRG back into yarn.
recyclable_offcuts_description: Yes, we have a recycling program through our internal Waste Warriors team. Everything is separated to be upcycled / reused through local charities or recycled through TRG (Textile Recyclers Group).
recycling_process_description: Yes it can be recycled through TRG back into yarn.
water_reduction_techniques: We don't have this information from the manufacturer

product_description: A coarsely textured printable base cloth, waterproof backing, antimicrobial and OEKO-TEX certified
recyclable_percentage_description: Yes you can recycled polyester by partnering with companies such as Textile Recyclers Group (TRG) as we do
recyclable_offcuts_description: Yes, we have a recycling program through our internal Waste Warriors team. Everything is separated to be upcycled / reused through local charities or recycled through TRG (Textile Recyclers Group).
recycling_process_description: We recycled all of our polyester offcuts and sampling by partnering with Textile Recyclers Group at their recycling depot in Sydney. They recycle back into yarn.
water_reduction_techniques: At our printing facility in Sydney we use recycled water - and the whole digital and dye sublimation printing process uses very little water
minimisation_design_strategy: Designs can be railroaded which can help reduce offcuts for upholsterer but we print on demand so very little wastage
other_comments: To get a deeper understand of our sustainable printing processes and practices please visit https://materialised.com.au/sustainability/
type_of_packaging: 100% recycled cardboard cores and soft clear plastic. Sometimes palletised depending on quantity.

product_name: Crypton Aria Snow - Printable Base Cloth
product_description: Crypton Aria is a printable, durable velvet textile base cloth featuring a waterproof backing.
recyclable_percentage_description: We recycled all of our Crypton offcuts and sampling by partnering with Textile Recyclers Group at their recycling depot in Sydney. They recycle back into yarn.
recyclable_offcuts_description: Crypton maintains an ongoing recycling program of manufacturing remnants. And locally, we have a recycling program through our internal Waste Warriors team. Everything is separated to be upcycled / reused through local charities or recycled through TRG (Textile Recyclers Group). It would need to be the upholsterer / workroom that builds their own local partnership for this.
water_reduction_techniques: To print the design onto this base cloth in Sydney, we use the dye sublimation method which uses very little water. And we print on demand which reduces wastage. We also have rainwater tanks for other water usage at our print facility.
minimisation_design_strategy: Depending on the chosen print, a design can be printed railroaded to minimise wastage.
other_comments:
Yarn is most often bought on the spot market so we can only provide details of the country of manufacture i.e. where the base cloth is milled. And in the case of Crypton, we are only allowed to detail their Head Office and main mill in the US.
Crypton is a company very committed to sustainability. You can read their Eco Statement and see more information here: https://materialised.com.au/crypton-waterproof-fabric/
You can learn about our sustainability statement and practices here: https://materialised.com.au/sustainability/
This is a link to our internal Waste Warriors team, list of charities we donate to: https://materialised.com.au/sustainability/recycling-charities/
type_of_packaging: 100% recycled cardboard cores and clear plastic wrap. Pallets are used if the quantity is large.

product_description: PVC-free, naturally breathable and enhances indoor air quality through CleanAir technology
minimisation_design_strategy: N/a
other_comments:
We are under an NDA for manufacturer information and either don't get or can't share info such as manufacturer location. Therefore for we have listed the supplier's head office info in the US.

This woven silica wall covering is PVC-free, naturally breathable and enhances indoor air quality. It is derived from silica sand with a bio-based coating.

This CleanAir technology uniquely removes VOCs from the air, meaning that formaldehyde absorption is permanently captured and never released. It is cadmium and mercury free; contains no heavy metals and is phenol free.
type_of_packaging: 100% recycled cardboard core; clear plastic wrapping

recycled_content_description: 100% recycled PET. 60% post-consumer recycled; 40% pre-consumer recycled.

product_description: Highly stain resistant and cleanable with an exclusive Crypton finish, it's leather, redefined!
recyclable_percentage_description: See above
recyclable_offcuts_description: There are two avenues available: 1) Upcycling waste from leather manufacturing and/or upholstery processes, where the off-cuts can be sold to accessories manufacturers who use those off-cuts for things pike bags or wallets (Cortina waste goes this route), or 2) Recycled leather from furniture which is used to make bonded leather, where it’s ground up and mixed with adhesives and bonding agents to manufacture bonded leather for things like belts and bags.
recycling_process_description: See above
compostable_conditions: Leather is biodegradable but it’s difficult to put %’s on, as the different types of leather and then also different types of finishing chemicals affect the timeline. Veg-tanned leathers will biodegrade in 6-12 months.  Then, chrome-tanned leathers vary – with pure anilines, those not having pigment on their surface perhaps taking between 5-10 years, and pigmented -finish articles maybe taking up to 50-100 years.  But if we’re looking at landfills and the different types, that will also have an effect.  Any landfill which allows air and moisture to reach the leather material will accelerate or at least mean biodegrading happens most quickly, but if the leather were deep in a landfill, and not being subjected to much air or moisture that leather would only biodegrade extremely slowly.
reusable_description: There are two avenues available: 1) Upcycling waste from leather manufacturing and/or upholstery processes, where the off-cuts can be sold to accessories manufacturers who use those off-cuts for things pike bags or wallets (Cortina waste goes this route), or 2) Recycled leather from furniture which is used to make bonded leather, where it’s ground up and mixed with adhesives and bonding agents to manufacture bonded leather for things like belts and bags.
minimisation_design_strategy: We carefully select the closest sized hide to meet your requirements
other_comments:
Additional Safety & Compliance info for Crypton Leather:
Free of fluoride, C6, PFAs, or PFOAs
Free of PBA, PVC, Phthalates, or elastomers
Free of heavy metals or silver
Free of conflict minerals
SCS certified for ultra-low VOCs to meet LEED certification requirements
Compliant with stringent European REACH standards
Cleared from California Prop 65 warning
type_of_packaging: Recycled cardboard boxes

product_description: A high-performance, PVC-free, sustainable alternative to vinyl upholstery with Product EPD
recycled_content_description: 100% silica which is derived from sand
transport_emissions_minimisation_techniq: Please refer to A4 and C2 transport environmental performance in the EPD documentation
minimisation_design_strategy: N/A
other_comments:
Silica was developed over the course of two years with the goal of creating a new coated fabric from silicone, with zero PVC and zero solvents, while achieving high performance.

•	PVC free
•	Ink erasable with water
•	All tested stains clean with a damp cloth
•	Bleach cleanable
•	Extremely durable
•	Extreme colourfastness
•	Inherently antimicrobial and anti-fungal
•	GREENGUARD Gold certified
•	Product EPD
type_of_packaging: 100% recycled carboard cores and clear soft plastic wrapping that can be recycled

type_of_packaging: 100% recycled cardboard cores and clear plastic wrap. Pallets are used if the quantity is large.

product_description: Our Homespun design printed on Midnight, an acoustic curtain fabric NRC 0.58
recyclable_percentage_description: We recycled all of our polyester offcuts and sampling by partnering with Textile Recyclers Group at their recycling depot in Sydney. They recycle back into yarn.
recyclable_offcuts_description: Yes, we have a recycling program through our internal Waste Warriors team. Everything is separated to be upcycled / reused through local charities or recycled through TRG (Textile Recyclers Group).
recycled_content_description: 100% recycled. See Global Recycled Standard certificate
recycling_process_description: It can be recycled back into yarn.
minimisation_design_strategy: We print to order so there is very little wastage and whatever offcuts we have here are repurposed.
other_comments:
KEY FEATURES:

It is an acoustic curtain fabric with an NRC of 0.58.
Made with 100% post-consumer recycled polyester, using plastic water bottles and cola bottles.
type_of_packaging: 100% recycled cardboard core and a clear plastic wrap that can be recycled

product_description: Flex is a 35oz heavy-duty, vinyl wall covering, Type III and low VOC
minimisation_design_strategy: Use a proper installer who is used to working with this type of product and reads the installation instructions correctly
other_comments: Available in 10 designs and multiple colourways, plus matching Corner guards
type_of_packaging: 100% recycled cardboard cores and soft plastic that can be recycled

product_description: A whimsical emboss in the NuFelt acoustic wall covering range. 15 colours.
recyclable_offcuts_description: Yes, we have a recycling program through our internal Waste Warriors team. Everything is separated to be upcycled / reused through local charities or recycled through TRG (Textile Recyclers Group).
recycling_process_description: Yes it can be recycled through onshore facilities and made back into recycled yarn.
water_reduction_techniques: We don't have this information from the manufacturer
minimisation_design_strategy: N/a
specific_installation_methods: No glue, plasterboard etc. can be attached to the product when recycled.
other_comments:
Made from recycled bottles.
Reduced Environmental Impact CAL 01350.
May be recycled through reclamation.
Cadmium and mercury free.
Contains no heavy metals.
Does not contain DEHP plasticisers.
Free of PBDE’s (Brominated Flame Retardants)

product_description: A printable, finely textured base cloth with a waterproof backing. Antimicrobial and soil repellent.
recyclable_percentage_description: Yes, we have a recycling program through our internal Waste Warriors team. Everything is separated to be upcycled / reused through local charities or recycled through TRG (Textile Recyclers Group).
recyclable_offcuts_description: This product can be recycled through various programs in Australia, such as TRG, as long as it is uncontaminated i.e. no staples, hooks or adhesives.
recycling_process_description: We recycle unusable offcuts with onshore Textile Recyclers Group where it is made back into recycled yarn
water_reduction_techniques: Our digital print facilities uses little to no water.
minimisation_design_strategy: We print on demand so there is very little wastage. What can be reused is picked up by our local charity partners. And we have a recycling program with TRG where unusable offcuts are recycled back into yarn.
factory_finished_description: Printing of designs onto the textile substrate involves dye sublimation, the initial stage of which is printing the design onto FSC certified paper, using OEKO-TEX ECO PASSPORT certified inks.
other_comments:
https://materialised.com.au/sustainability/
https://materialised.com.au/sustainable-fabric-and-walls/
https://materialised.com.au/sustainability/recycling-charities/
type_of_packaging: We are APCO members and achieved a Beyond Best Practice overall performance level for the reporting period January – December 2022. This means we have received the highest performance level and made significant progress on our packaging sustainability journey. You can read more about using recycling and upcycling packaging on our website https://materialised.com.au/sustainability/recycling-charities/

product_description: A contemporary, daring and versatile real leather, protected with Crypton
recyclable_percentage_description: See above
recyclable_offcuts_description: There are two avenues available: 1) Upcycling waste from leather manufacturing and/or upholstery processes, where the off-cuts can be sold to accessories manufacturers who use those off-cuts for things pike bags or wallets (Cortina waste goes this route), or 2) Recycled leather from furniture which is used to make bonded leather, where it’s ground up and mixed with adhesives and bonding agents to manufacture bonded leather for things like belts and bags.
recycling_process_description: See above
compostable_conditions: Leather is biodegradable but it’s difficult to put %’s on, as the different types of leather and then also different types of finishing chemicals affect the timeline. Veg-tanned leathers will biodegrade in 6-12 months.  Then, chrome-tanned leathers vary – with pure anilines, those not having pigment on their surface perhaps taking between 5-10 years, and pigmented -finish articles maybe taking up to 50-100 years.  But if we’re looking at landfills and the different types, that will also have an effect.  Any landfill which allows air and moisture to reach the leather material will accelerate or at least mean biodegrading happens most quickly, but if the leather were deep in a landfill, and not being subjected to much air or moisture that leather would only biodegrade extremely slowly.
reusable_description: There are two avenues available: 1) Upcycling waste from leather manufacturing and/or upholstery processes, where the off-cuts can be sold to accessories manufacturers who use those off-cuts for things pike bags or wallets (Cortina waste goes this route), or 2) Recycled leather from furniture which is used to make bonded leather, where it’s ground up and mixed with adhesives and bonding agents to manufacture bonded leather for things like belts and bags.
minimisation_design_strategy: We carefully select the closest sized hide to meet your requirements
other_comments:
Additional Safety & Compliance info for Crypton Leather:
Free of fluoride, C6, PFAs, or PFOAs
Free of PBA, PVC, Phthalates, or elastomers
Free of heavy metals or silver
Free of conflict minerals
SCS certified for ultra-low VOCs to meet LEED certification requirements
Compliant with stringent European REACH standards
Cleared from California Prop 65 warning
type_of_packaging: Recycled cardboard boxes

recyclable_percentage_description: Yes, we have a recycling program through our internal Waste Warriors team. Everything is separated to be upcycled / reused through local charities or recycled through TRG (Textile Recyclers Group).
recyclable_offcuts_description: This product can be recycled through various programs in Australia, such as TRG, as long as it is uncontaminated i.e. no staples, hooks or adhesives.

minimisation_design_strategy: We print on demand so there is very little wastage. What can be reused is picked up by our local charity partners. And we have a recycling program with TRG where unusable offcuts are recycled back into yarn.

product_description: A biodegradable vinyl textile made of 100% Hyphyn™, a new industry benchmark for sustainability
recycled_content_description: 50% bio-attributed vinyl sourced from forestry waste and 100% recycled polyester backing
compostable_conditions: It is a 100% Hyphyn™ biodegradable vinyl crafted with a proprietary enzyme system, 90%+ biodegradation within 24 months in landfill conditions.
minimisation_design_strategy: N/a
other_comments: We are under an NDA for manufacturer information and either don't get or can't share info such as manufacturer location. Therefore for we have listed the supplier's head office info in the US.
type_of_packaging: 100% recycled cardboard cores; clear plastic wrapping
